review_title: Go for the education, leave to actually advance and make money
pros: The people that you interact with daily - there are quite a few who are stuck in their ways but for every bad apple there are at least 5 or 6 that are good. The location is convenient and free parking! There are some perks like DMV on site days and small farmers markets - an Associate pantry too.
cons: No career advancement, loads of favoritism, upper leadership is definitely a 'good old boys' club, the organization has massive debt/financial constraints but always rewards the C suite and above, fake titles that make it difficult to market yourself post MWHC, not good pay for the area (HR insists we aren't worth NOVA salaries even though we get NOVA awards) and lack of follow up. oh, and sexual harassment/disrespectful behavior - operations departments will always excuse their men

review_title: They do NOT appreciate nursing staff!  Prepare to zip your lip or be pulled into HR.  POOR management.
pros: Good pay, okay benefits, flexible scheduling.  Good teamwork in some units.
cons: Beware of starting a job here.  Note the date of this review.  Management has no moral courage.  Nurses are getting written up for ridiculous reasons that have nothing to do with quality of care or how well you take care of your patients.  The CNO is a joke.  They want to cut costs everywhere except in upper management/executives.  I hope they get bought out.  iCare standards are ridiculous when they expect you to perform like a robot.  I got sick of hearing, "It is what it is."  If something is making your staff unhappy, then fix it!    ICU's nurses are frequently tripled and the only reason the patients get reasonable care is that nurses stick together as a team.  Management doesn't care.  It's common to hear, "We are working on that," and nothing ever happens.

review_title: Started out great and steadily went downhill!
job_title: Food Service Associate in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: They had pretty good benefits and once I finished high school they immediately made me .5 status which gave me benefits, including tuition reimbursement. After the first semester they actually paid the tuition up front and as long as I got at least a C in the course it was completely paid for. They also worked with my school schedule.
cons: Steady went down hill. The turnover at the upper management positions was incredible. Sometimes they had absolutely no idea what was actually going on. They play a lot of favorites and there are a lot of relatives that have each others back. Sometimes they would complain because I stayed an extra five minutes on my break. But some people that were related to the managers would take their thirty minute breaks and then come back for a little then leave the hospital to go play the lottery. When I went to complain about that the would say don't be a snitch. But it was those exact people leaving to play the lottery that would be telling on me.

cons: Work/life balance is non-existent, management does not train, always too much workload

pros: 1.There is teamwork. I like this code of ethics and the pillars of strength, the ICARE.I got a lot of ICARE points. It made us proud of our jobs and we worked as a team.
cons:
1.They phased out a lot of jobs and continue to do so. they say they are very much for profit as everything revolved around getting as many patients in and out as possible.
2.If you are over 40 beware. Your job is always at risk. 
3.Training is not specific to the job, but more to the entire company in general.
4. They took away differentials, bonuses, weekend nighttime pay,and peoples retirement, shortened the paid leave programs and lumped them all together.and at the same time, saying they had to to keep us in jobs so we would go along with it, then at the same time, in went new carpet all over the hospital and one by one the different departments got a total makeover, whole hospital got new interior paint, etc and the president got a bonus in the six figures that Christmas! then they still laid off over 60 people at once saying they didnt have enough money and had to do cutbacks on jobs. really? some very trustworthiness and lying going on there.

pros: I've been employed at MWHC for the past 15 years and have watched carefully as healthcare has had to make huge changes to the way that they do business.  MWHC has not been immune to the challenges facing healthcare today and has gone through all of the same struggles that other hospitals have faced.  However, I feel that MWHC has faced these challenges with dignity and respect for their Associates and made the tough decisions that have had to be made with care and compassion for those who were most impacted.  The "new normal" is not easy, and I'm sure that every hospital feels the same, but the MWHC Team is very much committed to providing high quality care for our patients while at the same time providing Associates with opportunities for growth and process improvement.
cons: Nothing specific for MWHC.  Healthcare in general is a very challenging and high stress career.

review_title: This organization is only concerned about money, certainly not their employee's or patients.
pros: There are no good reasons for working here, which is why everyone's looking for another job.
cons: Poor leadership, poor management, not paid enough for all the work expected from them. They want 1 person to do the job of 2 or 3 people, yet keep taking away our bonuses, benefits, and now require anyone insured through them to pay higher premiums if the person smokes ( and not willing to stop) or has any health conditions and won't comply with working with a health coach. They expect you to work with the coach on your own time, not during work hours and your required to work with the coach several times a month for an extended period of time.

review_title: A lot of work for a low pay
job_title: Certified Nurse Assistant in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: You meet a lot of nice people and great co workers. Free food delivery to us sometimes.  Self schedule and I only worked every 3rd weekend. I like working 3 days and having 4 days off.
cons: Very high depending and stressful job at times. RN nurses expected too much from us. There's only 2 CNAs working 32 patients ( 16 each). When we do have a third CNA, the 3rd one always get floated to another unit. 2 south is a very busy floor and need 3 CNAs.  The pay is tooo low for what all the CNAs do there. CNA are expected to do desk work as well. A total different job then a CNA job duties.  RN nurses gets notice and get rewards for their hard work, but CNA doesn't. We work just as hard!

pros: None.  I found that out during my first week.  The place was only a stepping stone.
cons: Everything.  Until management is replaced (since the current management has an attitude of "Well it is what it is") nothing will change.  HR is a joke.  I saw that during my orientation.  Management and HR play by their own rules.  They habitually violate HIPAA on their own employees to gain information to write you up to fire you. Employee Health and Medical Arts Pharmacy both violated my privacy rights.  The Radiology Dept is a total disaster.  1 or 2 transporters to service 5-6 modalities!  Management is disrespectful, demeaning, and belittling to staff and they don't care who they do this in front of - other employees and patients.  This place is the perfect example of how NOT to run a hospital.

review_title: For the community but not the employees..
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: The company is great as far as helping the community. For the position I worked I was at the switch board connecting callers to patients, departments, or associates. The job itself is very easy once you get the hang of it.
cons: You have to be available 24/7 as you are considered essential personnel. Lack of communication between the teams and management. Failure to keep promises made to employees, along with no job security. The company is not making money therefore they cannot provide raises for current employees, nor hire the adequate amount of staff needed for proper everyday function of the office. They would rather work you to death than hire more staff.

review_title: Mary Washington Healthcare is in a financial crisis and contracting various departments out to other companies.
pros: They have no regards to how these other companies treat their employees and the new CEO, Michael McDermott has been made aware of these problems and made it clear that they do not care. As long as it saves them money, they are allowing these other companies to take our benefits away and work us like slaves. We no longer get paid extra for holidays, only regular pay and we are required to work holidays.
cons: Working here requires very stringent rules regarding absenteeism, yet we are a hospital filled with germs and disease. Try staying healthy in an atmosphere such as this, it's difficult.

pros: I worked with some great people that were patient focused and gave 110%.  I also worked with some who were there to do the minimum required for a paycheck.Unfortunately no  difference in recognition
cons: The organization sees little value in experienced nurses and almost would rather see us go to preserve their bottom line.   I do believe that if you asked the patient who they wanted an experienced nurse or the multitude of VPs with overinflated salaries - I think we know what the answer would be.

job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: Pay is higher than what you will find at most OB offices in the area. Great experience for new grads. The radiologist are amazing guys to work for.  Super nice, and laid back. Almost every patient can come down unless in the ICU, NICU, or nursery. Wide variety of exams! Call is only back up call (depending on location) So at the main hospital it is pretty rare you will actually get called in, but it does happen every so often. Call pay is great!
cons: High turn over rate. They fire people easily! Everything is so black and white with HR, so you need to be very careful not to make mistakes. Somewhat busy, but you can only do 1 patient at a time so don't let it get to you.

pros: None, None, None, None, None
cons: Terrible hours, Terrible pay, Terrible working conditions.   I have been there for 5 yrs and have had 1 raise which was .25 cents per hour .  Turn over rate is terrible.  People constantly leaving or being fired for stupid stuff.  Lucky if you get your 30 min lunch break.   Last night only had 2 Phlebotomist to get all morning blood draws done.  500 bed hospital.  Day shift had one person on floor and one in ER.  Lets hope there isn't a major disaster in the Fredericksburg area.  Needless to say management doesn't work weekends so you have to fend for yourself and get it done.   There is not room for advancement you are stuck there and they don't work with school schedules if you decided you wanted to pursue a different career.  I am handing in my resignation.  I have had enough.

pros: Self scheduling, management is flexible and concerned about the welfare of their staff.  Decent base pay.
cons: No raises, limited compensation, no bonuses.  Executives make six figures while the hospital staff gets no raises, bonuses, or incentives.  Too many chiefs, not enough indians so to speak.  The CEO is a millionaire because of the hard work of the staff.  Executives care more about their bottom line than what the employees think.

pros: Overcoming a low several years ago attitudes, pay and morale have improved greatly throughout the organization. I respect the new leadership and like who I work with and for. We work together and communicate more openly then in my previous 30+ years at this company. Its exciting to see how we continue to improve.
cons: Our greatest limiting factor is our outdated software systems.  While they are working to upgrade we got too far behind the curve and are paying for it. It limits our notification and communications speed and versatility. Medical equipment is current and state of the art.

pros: Very professional and organized atmosphere. There was never a doubt that the hospital and every part of the hospital was being run to a very high standard. I felt patients were taken care of in my unit and all of the team members outside of my unit were relatively courteous.
cons: They were a bit stringent with their rules. The work culture held employees to a very high standard with little leeway. I did not always feel like I was being viewed as a person and not a machine. It was very hard and frowned upon for me to get any time off. I was encouraged to work very long shifts at times even when I felt it was pushing the limit for any employee.

pros: Friendly and supportive environment. Truly a great place to work. This is an organization who believes in taking care of their employees who in turn make patient care their top priority.  Top level leadership engages employees in making this the best place to work. When conducting my job search, this was the only organization in the area that I considered. Take the time to look into career opportunities at Mary Washington Healthcare.  You won't be disappointed!!
cons: None that I can note since being an associate of Mary Washington Healthcare for the last seven months.  No complaints so far.

pros: Coworkers and managers within security, some medical staff
cons:
Extremely low pay for what MWHC expects from security

MWHC wants security to bend the rules on reports to minimize risk and liability for the company instead of writing accurate reports to protect everyone fairly in a situation

Mostly disrespectful medical staff, few exceptions

Medical staff are unwilling to call police if patients become combative because of additional paperwork, expecting security to physically handle the patient without any kind of protection and risking the personal liability of the security officer

pros: Mostly Great co-workers at all facilities, equipment being modernized, educational reimbursement benefit, great Vision Plan.
cons: Obvious rampant favoritism and nepotism, HR only serves to cover unethical business practices. Middle Management preaches patient care but worships $$$ above all else to the detriment of staff and patient health, especially in the outpatient centers that are actually a for- profit division of the non-profit company. Contradictory policies selectively issued and enforced against staff who call managers out on their conflicting statements. The staff turnover wheel keeps spinning due to all this.

review_title: Think carefully before taking a job here!
pros: A paycheck of course, the co-workers I worked with and being able to help the patient's.
cons:
First off, if you are reading all of these glowing 4 & 5 star reviews, realize the hospital has been on "damage control" trying to reverse it's image here on Glassdoor.  If you want to really know what it going on with this company, PLEASE take the time and go back several pages to see what people are really saying.  Someone or a group of people are coming on this website putting up fake positive reviews about how great it is to work here.  Don't be naive and buy into this.  

The job I had to do in and of itself was not bad and I actually would probably still be working here if it were not for the people I had to work under.   It was dealing with inept managers, who thought they were doing us a favor by simply being in their presence.  If you enjoy working with large numbers of people who are narcissistic, moody and like to micro manage every move you make, then you will do just fine here.  One of the biggest changes they made was combining various positions into one job title.  This of course caused high stress and burn out among many employees in various positions.  

In my department alone, I can't even tell you how many people were either forced out or quit their jobs.  And I am talking about really good people with a lot of education, job experience and numerous credentials behind their name.  As long as you tow the line, you will probably be alright.  Go against your manager on anything or question something that is being done, you will end up with a big target on your back and writing your own pink-slip.  

I thought the problems were confined to my department, but when I would talk with other people that I knew in other parts of the hospital, they would tell me they were having similar issues.  This told me that there was a systemic problem throughout.  Of course the ones that end up suffering the most from all of this dysfunction are the patient's.  Just google reviews of the hospital on the internet from patient's who have come to this hospital, it speaks volumes...

pros: You get a paycheck.  I would also like to think that I am making a difference because I do like to help people and it is the reason I chose to work in healthcare.
cons: The hospital has been having serious financial issues for years, and their way of "fixing" the problem is to eliminate staff.  This has caused a serious burden for the existing staff, causing burnout, low morale and questionable patient care.  Employee morale is very low across many departments and across different job titles.

job_title: Desktop Support in Virginia Beach, VA
pros:
A very friendly environment to work in, with great nurses and doctors. 

Computers are easy to fix Dell's.

You will easily stay busy. 

You will make a difference simply helping those that help many others.
cons:
Likely only hire you if you're friends with someone or have family. Even if you are the perfect tech, this is guaranteed. 
This will lead to some very very bad teams and lopsided workloads.

Senior managers don't get any trouble when they are often the problem of everything.  

You will have no idea what is going on for a long time.

It will continue to not make sense. 

Things will go wrong.

review_title: Manager: Revenue Cycle and Support Services
job_title: Manager: Revenue Cycle and Support Services in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: I have been blessed to be part of this organization for over 26 years.  It is a great place to work with a team environment and encouragement to continue to grow professionally.  As a manager/Leader  it is important to be a resource for all associates  to assist them to reach their dreams.  MWHC does that everyday and encourages us to be our best.
cons: Don't really have any at this time

pros: Patient-centered philosophy with fair compensation and generous benefits for nursing positions.  Patient to nurse ratio allows for a concentrated level of care for each one.  Teamwork is emphasized and the interdepartmental collaboration is exceptional.  Great place to work.
cons: The pros far outweigh the cons.  If I had to identify an area of concern it would be the questionable disappearance of mid-to-upper level management with no warning or explanation.

review_title: the pay could be better but benifits and good people keep me here
pros: The benefits are great if you make under the amount for your family size they give you premium waver and very little if any copayments and prescription cost.
cons: no raise no tuition reimbursements this year and the pay is sad for the education that you recieved.

pros: Exercise and more exercise. I was a chart runner.  The shift went by very quickly because there was plenty to do everyday.
cons: The Coworkers could be difficult to deal with and little support was available from the department management at the hospital.

review_title: It was the best experience ever!
job_title: Certified Surgical Tech in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: I met a lot of interesting people. Scrubbed in in a lot of different specialties which I enjoyed very much. Assisting a Surgeon in surgery was so very rewarding.  I was born to take care of people, it is in my blood.
cons: The downside was having to leave. I loved working there.  I miss the Surgeons, RN's, and all the other staff.  It was really fun working there.

pros: Flexible scheduling, mileage reimbursement, good health benefits and patient-oriented management team.   Staff tries to work together to improve workload among the team.
cons: Average salary, but the health benefits help to compensate.  If you do not need health benefits, the pay per visit rate is good.  If you are willing to be flexible in where you travel you can keep busy.

pros:
Great working culture, great community presence.
A place where you can work with your heart and see tangible community involvement/benefit.
cons:
Leadership plans are becoming more and more transparent by the day, but need to be improved.
Single healthcare organization will be getting difficult to maintain this status by each year.

review_title: Poor management, disrespect between departments and incompetent staff, among several other issues.
job_title: Central Sterile Reprocessing Tech I in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: There are some descent career opportunities, always job openings.
cons: The management from the top down is incompetent.  There is favoritism and downright corruption throughout all levels.  No one respects each other, and mistakes made by staff that affect patient care are ignored on a daily basis.  There are very few honest hardworking people in this company.

pros: Because this is a large, diversified health care system there are plenty of opportunities for advancement. Senior level management communication to employees was always excellent and the addition of physician liasions provided two-way communication about issues, system changes, etc.
cons: Like any large company, employees may initially feel overwhelmed. Orientation for other than nursing staff seemed incomplete/inadequate/confusing.

pros: I acutally liked the job itself but there were so many obstacles and not enough staff to support me being able to excel. Fast paced - able to lose track of time by keeping busy. Satisfaction when meeting goals. EMR
cons: Low pay. Expected to use paid time off for holidays - no holiday pay. Expensive insurance and had to wait months to get dr appt. At times expected to work mandatory over time. Unstaffed. High turnover - at least 11 to 12 people either transferred to some where else in the mary washington network or just left. And for the last like 9 months i was there we couldnt find a replacement manager for the one that left so there was a group of people splitting the tasks which of course effects the rest of the teams productivity.

pros:
I feel my work is valued.  Other pros:  
- teamwork
- trust
- learning opportunities
- ethical
- quality, compassionate care
- commitment to community
- internal awards and recognition
- close to home
cons: small pockets of negativity from people who are perpetually unhappy

pros: Great people who care for our community. Outstanding professionals providing state of the art healthcare.  Engaged, empowered associates who genuinely like to show up to be a part of Mary Washington Healthcare's team!
cons: Not many that I can think of. Great local organization creating a great work culture, and taking steps to navigate the transforming healthcare landscape!

pros:
Working with different people 
Pay good for experience 
Can transfer anywhere in the hospital
Get awards for a job well done
Keep you updated on what is going on throughout hospital
cons:
Ignorant workers on all floors
They will lie to you
Will try to run over you
Need new carts that actually works 
People steal from lockers, carts and refrigerators 
Need to care more about employees

pros: My work is close to home.  Flexibility in my role with some autonomy. Benefits are decent. I have a great staff.
cons: Limited opportunities for advancement. Somewhat political organization. Pay is lower than average. Senior execs are not present at associate level.

job_title: Corporate Governance Manager in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: Love my job! Supportive leadership, encourage growth and provide learning opportunities, in-market salary and good benefit package.  The senior leadership team and CEO live the organization's mission.
cons: Financial pressures on healthcare organizations in general. However, MWHC focuses on maintaining and sustaining its financial performance, while working to ensure appropriate staffing and other resources to provide excellent care to our patients

pros: Free parking and some great coworkers. The average associate is a decent person. There is a lot of teamwork that is brought on by individuals. There are some really great nurses at MWHC.
cons: Management sucks especially in IT. No point in complaining to HR because they don’t do anything. The organization talks about iCare and Always values yet there are double standards. The pay scale depends on how much tail you kiss. Very political and unfairness runs wild, but again, nothing will ever change.

pros: Enjoyed the people I worked with, and enjoyed working in the ER.  It was stressful, but I personally like that fast pace.
cons: Pay is too low for this area's high cost of living.  Clocking in and out for lunch when leaving campus is a bit much.  Felt like I was treated like a child.

pros: Benefits were quite good.  Worked with some wonderful colleagues.  The organization is very community minded and provides much needed services.
cons: At times it was a very political place to work which was disconcerting.  This proved to be too much of a distraction.

pros: Culture is changing for the best, staff provides great care, excellent trained physicians, great community to live and raise a family.
cons: 401k benefits and match would be an area of improvement, especially for those tenured beyond 3-5 years. Traffic commute, definitely live local.

pros: Thankful to work in a Healthcare facility that is focused on providing safe, quality patient care.  Teams treat each other respectfully and the "Always" courses have reminded us why we are here.
cons: CEO is incorrectly listed on Glassdoor.

pros: You will always have a job because they always need help.
cons: Unorganized, patient to nurse ratio is very high, not magnet, education is not valued therefore the executives and leadership are not the brightest, etc.

pros:
The team I work with is excellent; we work well together and have been able to develop more efficient processes. 
Pay and benefits are good. 
Location is good - no long commute on 95.
Increased technology is appreciated by staff.
cons: Few flexible work options (scheduling, working remotely).

review_title: Amazing people who care about the community
pros: People, commitment to quality and care, great team and fun people,  always culture,
cons: Need to spread the word on how amazing MWHC is and what we are doing for our community

pros: People are nice and flexible hours.
cons: Waste money on consultants that really aren't more knowledgeable then employees.   Would be better off to trust employees, they have the best interests of organization at heart.

pros: Pay is okay but could be better
cons: Management doesn't listen or doesn't care. Way too many executives and still adding more while clinical staff is constantly short staffed. Go through reorganization and keep the same bad managers. Executives are clueless and HR won't help with anything other than covering a Manager or the company.

pros: A good reason to work you make your own hours and I'm a member of there union
cons: The downside about IHSS is that there's no date set when you get paid not even for people with straight deposits.
